duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop initiatives and implementation systems for the internal HR structure, including recruiting, onboarding, employee training, development, relations, retention, performance management, payroll, benefits administration, policies, procedures, HR compliance, and DEI&B initiatives.
Partner with the leadership team to develop and execute HR objectives and strategies.
Manage the talent acquisition process, including full-cycle recruitment and onboarding activities.
Respond to day-to-day employee inquiries pertaining to HR-related matters.
Coordinate the performance management process and provide training and coaching to managers and staff.
Manage employee relations, including conducting investigations if necessary.
Collaborate on new HR initiatives, employee retention, professional learning programs, and culture enhancing strategies.
Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations and recommend best practices for policies and procedures.
Acquire knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and innovative technologies in HR, talent management, and employment law.
Support the accounting team in the implementation of payroll and benefits administration processes.
Support the Office Manager with internal event planning.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (Master's preferred)
SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP or SPHR or PHR certification preferred
